dt: {bc}one of the six or seven great divisions of land on the globe

et: (senses 1-2) borrowed from Middle French & Latin; Middle French, "land forming part of a continuous mass (as opposed to an island)," borrowed from Latin {it}continent-, continens{/it} (short for {it}terra continens{/it}), from {it}continent-, continens,{/it} adjective, "uninterrupted, continuous, forming part of a continuous mass," from present participle of {it}continēre{/it} "to hold together, restrain, have as contents"; (senses 3 & 4) probably borrowed from Medieval Latin {it}continentia{/it} "container, content, tenor (of a document)," noun derivative of Latin {it}continent-, continens,{/it} present participle of {it}continēre{/it} {ma}{mat|contain|}{/ma}

The regular outcome of Medieval Latin {it}continentia{/it} following the rules for adopting such nouns in English would have been {it}continence,{/it} but as this word was already in use as an abstract noun, writers may have resorted to {it}continent.{/it} Note {it}continent{/it} in Middle English used by the translator of Chauliac's {it}Grande Chirurgie{/it} in the sense "content."
shortdef: one of the six or seven great divisions of land on the globe
the continent of Europe —used with the

dt.t: Most children are {wi}continent{/wi} by the age of three.

et: Middle English {it}contynent{/it} "abstemious, refraining from sexual intercourse," borrowed from Middle French {it}continent,{/it} borrowed from Medieval Latin {it}continent-, continens,{/it} going back to Latin, "restrained, not indulging in excesses," from present participle of {it}continēre{/it} "to hold together, restrain, have as contents" {ma}{mat|contain|}{/ma}

dt.t: It was by the merest caprice of fortune that they headed toward the west coast of Africa, instead of toward Zanzibar on the opposite side of the {wi}dark continent{/wi}.
… little was actually known about the interior of the {wi}Dark Continent{/wi} until the mid-1800s.
From Hiroshima on August 6, 1945, the world received the shocking discovery that man had opened the {wi}dark continent{/wi} of the atom.

dt: {bc}the countries of Europe except for Great Britain and Ireland

dt.t: The book provides information on hotels in Britain and on {it}the Continent{/it}.

shortdef: the countries of Europe except for Great Britain and Ireland
